text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to explain what the Northern Ireland Protocol declared regarding a 'no hard border' on the island of Ireland, specifically mentioning 'no customs or regulatory checks' or 'related physical infrastructure'. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this in the section 'The Core Problem the Framework Tried to Solve', stating: 'Post-Brexit, the Ireland/Northern Ireland Protocol (2020) created a hard choice: either a land border on the island (politically impossible) or regulatory checks between GB and NI (economically disruptive). The Protocol chose the latter\u2014NI stayed aligned with EU rules for goods.' This accurately captures the essence of the Protocol's initial aim regarding the land border, which necessitated checks elsewhere (the sea border).", "criterion_id": "7316dd03-d67f-4ccb-8ed0-ceee41fa529a"}
